resources.string:
Sproutling® Wearable Baby Monitor is not a medical device.

 What Information May Be Collected 
 	 	 • First and last name of parent/caregiver 
 	 	 • Email address 
 	 	 • Mobile phone number 
 	 	 • Baby's photo, gender, date of birth and original due date 
 	 	 • Baby's heart rate, motion activity and room conditions (e.g. light level, temperature) 
 	 	 • Technical (Connected monitor ID, Device ID, IP address, etc.) 

 Why It’s Collected 
 	 	 • Internal operations (e.g. analytics, including determining sleep patterns) 

 With Whom It's Shared 
 	 	 • Internal operations\’ service providers

 Contact Us/Review or Delete Your or Your Baby's Collected Info 
 	 	 Mattel Consumer Relations 
 	 	 636 Girard Avenue
 	 	 East Aurora, NY 14052 
 	 	 Call: 1-877-219-8335 
 	 	 E-mail: service@mattel.com
By tapping I Accept, you agree to our Terms of Service and Privacy Statement.

This email address is already registered.
Birthday cannot be in the future
The original due date can be no more than 20 weeks after the birthday
The original due date can be no more than 6 weeks before the birthday
Why We Ask For Your Child\'s Original Due Date
Knowing if your baby was born early or late will help us to refine the accuracy of our insights.
There was a problem creating a child, please try again.
Please enable camera permission to take photo
Plug in the smart charger in the room where the baby sleeps.
Place the wearable on top of the smart charger.
Wait for the Smart Charger to blink blue, then tap Next.
Pull down to refresh or tap Other Network to enter manually.
Smart Charger failed to connect to Wifi. Please re-enter your settings.
Smart Charger can\'t join the network. Please re-type your password.
Watch the video walk-through to see the proper way to put the &appname; wearable on your baby.
Pull the end of the band through the slot to secure the sensor to the back of your baby\'s upper ankle.
The band is shaped like an arrow. When it\'s on correctly, it should point up toward your baby\'s heart. The smiling face should be in the same direction as your baby\'s face.
Make sure the band is on snugly enough that it stays on the back of your baby\'s ankle and doesn\'t move around.
The band should be large enough that no velcro touches the baby\'s leg. If the band is too small, look in the box for the larger band.
If you need to swap bands, remove the sensor. Then place the new band over the top of the sensor, and fit the ring into the groove around the sensor.
Watch the video walk-through to see the proper way to charge your &appname; wearable.
Place the wearable on top of the smart charger to charge. The light will slowly blink white while charging. Charge the wearable at least once per day when your baby is awake.
Wait for the Smart Charger to blink blue and then tap Try Again.
Your phone should be within 20 feet of the smart charger during setup.
Swipe down to make sure Bluetooth is turned on for your phone.
The Internet connection appears to be offline. Check your connection and try again.
Your baby\'s birthday is in the future. Come back to the Timeline after your baby is born.
Drag and Pinch to Set Crop
You will not be able to receieve any alerts. Tap here to enable.
Set Up a New Smart Sensor
Get push notifications for things that happen while your baby is wearing &appname;.
Get push notifications for things that happen while your baby is wearing &appname;. Select which types of events you\'d like to be notified about below.
We will send you selected room condition alerts when your baby is asleep or stirring and wearing the &appname; band.
We will send you selected sleep alerts when your baby is wearing the &appname; band and changes to asleep, stirring, or awake.
We will send you selected system alerts whenever they occur, whether your baby is wearing the &appname; band or not.
Remove This Device From My Account
The light on the Smart Charger will flash whenever the selected alerts occur.

Share &appname; with caregivers so they can see your baby\'s status and get alerts on their smartphones.
Ask your Caregiver to scan this code using the &appname; app to join your family account. For security purposes, this QR code will expire after 15 minutes.
Unplug Smart Charger and remove wearable from the top.
Leave the wearable off the Smart Charger and plug the Smart Charger back in.
When the Smart Charger shows a blinking blue light you can continue.
How to get the most accurate results from Sproutling

Sproutling is the first productItem of its kind for babies. We\'re just getting started and we plan to make updates as we go to make Sproutling even better.\nThe more you use Sproutling when your baby is sleeping, the more accurate your predictions will be.
Getting the best Asleep or Awake results

For best results, make sure your baby is:

• Put to sleep on their back
• Sleeping alone
• In a stationary crib or sleeping space
• With the Smart Charger in the same room

Our sleep algorithms are based on movement, so Sproutling does NOT work well in the following scenarios at this time:

• Breastfeeding
• Co-sleeping or bed sharing
• Baby held to sleep in arms, sling, or carrier
• In a swing or rocker
Getting the best wake up predictions

We know it\'s not always possible to avoid some of those scenarios. But keeping your Timeline up-to-date makes your wake up predictions more accurate. Adjust the start or end time of a nap, delete an incorrect one, or add a nap that was missed. And those corrections help Sproutling to learn too.
Our next big update will include some changes to make it better in some of those scenarios (but note that the American Academy of Pediatrics recommends NEVER bed sharing with baby.)
Let us know how you think we\'re doing. We want to hear your feedback. Drop us a line
%s has invited you to share a &appname; Baby Monitor.
Are you sure you want to remove %1$s as a Caregiver? They\'ll no longer have access to %2$s\'s data or receive notifications.
Enter the times of sleep that already happened
Tap Start to record sleep happening right now.
Begin time cannot be in the future
End time cannot be in the future
End time must be after begin time
Enter a nap that is 1 minute or longer
Nap must be at least 5 minute long or less than 15 hours.
Night sleep is all sleep that begins at about 7pm and ends at about 7am.
This is where your baby\'s sleep data will appear. Check here after your baby wakes up to see how they slept while wearing &appname;.
Stirring is when your baby is in between asleep and awake. Baby might move around or make sounds and may fall back to sleep.
Congrats, your six-month-old baby is ready to roll over. Would you like to turn off rollover alerts?
Are you sure you want to turn off rollover alerts? You can set your notification preferences later in Settings.
For the first 7 days of use, &appname;\'s algorithms learn about your unique baby to improve the accuracy of our insights and predictions. The more you use it, the better it gets.
We\'ve now learned enough about %s to unlock wake predictions.\n \n Our algorithms will continue learning and improving over time.
Enter your baby\'s head circumference, weight, and length to chart their growth over time.
%1$s may fall back to sleep for another %2$s
Make sure your baby wears the &appname;
There\'s been a significant change in your baby\'s heartbeat.
Put the wearable on the back of your baby\'s ankle to start monitoring.
Put the wearable on the back of your baby\'s ankle to resume monitoring.
Charge the wearable before using it again.
Put the wearable on the back of your baby\'s ankle to start monitoring.
Keep the wearable within 25 feet of the charger.
It might be too far from the charger or out of battery.
Check the internet connection on your phone.
This may be due to an unplugged charger or a lost internet connection.

We are currently updating the firmware on your device. Make sure your Smart Charger stays plugged in, and leave the Wearable on top.
The Wi-Fi signal is weak. Move the charger closer to your Wi-Fi router.
The wearable is almost out of battery. Charge it before using it again.
Keep the wearable within 25 feet of the charger for the best signal.
Tap your baby\'s name above to see their sleep history.
We\'re learning! Make sure your baby wears &appname; every day. Use the Log Sleep button to record all sleep.
Log all sleep during the learning period to teach &appname; about your baby.
Placeholder text for recommendation and information. the card will slip out from the bottom and give users helpful information.
Learn how our sleep algorithms work, and how to make them more accurate.\nRead more
&appname; needs to learn about %1$s for the first few days. Tap each circle to learn more.
Enter the begin and end time of each sleep session using the Sleep Log to help us learn your baby\'s schedule.
We\'re capturing the normal range of temperature in the room.
We\'re observing the normal humidity level in the room.
We\'re capturing the range of light levels in the room when %s sleeps.
We\'re observing the regular noise level in the room where %s sleeps.
The more your baby wears &appname;, the more we learn. Make sure %1$s wears &appname; each time %2$s sleeps. And remember to log any missed naps.

We are learning your baby\'s sleep patterns to predict when %2$s will wake up. Make sure you log any sleep that happens when %1$s doesn\'t wear &appname;. And check your baby\'s timeline to adjust the start and end time of naps if needed.
We are learning your baby\'s normal heartbeat so that we can alert you if it\'s abnormal while %2$s sleeps. Make sure %1$s wears &appname; every time %2$s sleeps to help us learn faster.
&appname; collects data about your baby across seven days to give you more accurate predictions about your baby\'s real-time status and %2$s sleep schedule.
After the Learning Period is over, our insights will continue to improve. They will automatically adjust as your baby grows and changes.
%1$s took a nap for %2$s. Tap to see %3$s nap in detail.
The learning period will take around 7 days for us to learn more about your baby.
&appname; is learning about %1$s. The more you use &appname;, the faster we\'ll learn.
We\'ve now learned enough about %1$s to start showing wake up predictions each time %2$s falls asleep. And &appname; will get more accurate over time.
The humidity was abnormally high in %1$s\'s room.
The light level was abnormally high in %1$s\'s room.
The room temperature was abnormally low in %1$s\'s room.
The noise level was abnormally high in %1$s\'s room.
Help &appname; learn your baby\'s sleep habits. Adjust the start and end time of naps captured by &appname; or use the + button

Turn on your phone\'s Bluetooth to set up your &appname;.
You can tap on this button to enter %1$s\'s sleep information.
Forgot to put on Sprouting and your baby fell asleep? Manually log sleep to help us provide more accurate sleep predictions.
Take a quick tour to learn what you can accomplish with &appname;.
The circle is a clock, and the position of the heart indicates the current time. You can also see a representation of your baby\'s heartbeat.
You can also tap here to turn on nightlight or music on your smart charger.
You can tap on %1$s\'s name to see sleep tips and reports in the timeline.
&appname; can now predict your baby\'s wake up time. The solid white line shows time slept so far, and the other line shows how much longer they are likely to sleep.

string-array.name: whats_new_feature_list
string-array.item: Now you can tell us if we got your baby\'s sleep status right
More intuitive hub controls design that includes timers and music playlists

resources.string: Taking the guesswork out of sleep.
Due to security concerns, Sproutling does not support WEP networks. Please upgrade your router to support WPA2.
We cannot connect to Wi-Fi networks with special characters in their names. Please change your network name or connect to another network.
Sproutling uses artificial intelligence to create sleep insights and predictions. We might be off at first, but we learn and get better over time.
We are learning your baby\'s sleep patterns to unlock wake up predictions. Log any sleep that happens when %s doesn\'t wear Sproutling.
The initial Learning Period lasts 7 days. During this time the algorithms are adapting to give you more accurate sleep insights. The more you use it the better.
Our insights continue to improve and adjust as your baby grows and changes. We also learn from all Sproutling owners for better results for you over time.
Tell us if your baby\'s sleep status is correct. The status may not change immediately, but letting us know helps us improve accuracy over time.
Selected time cannot be greater than current time.
The selected time cannot be lesser than sleep start time.
Your phone number will only be used when you need to recover your forgotten password.

We have detected some Bluetooth interference that\'s likely caused by your Wi-Fi router being too close to your Smart Charger. In order for &appname; to work accurately, please move the router at least 10 feet away from your Smart Charger.
Why we ask about current status
&appname; is a learning device. Your input helps us improve the accuracy of sleep status over time.

Email: ^1 
 Available Monday - Friday, 
 7am - 5pm EST 

 For information on Sproutling End of Service refund, tap on Visit Website.
